english: to wipe; to smear; to apply; to erase

etymology.interpretation: 扌, the hand element, signals a manual action like wiping, applying, or erasing. 末 supplies the approximate sound mǒ, guiding pronunciation while the hand component points to its action-oriented meaning.

examples.chinese: 他把白漆抹在墙上(他把白漆抹在牆上)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎ báiqī mǒ zài qiáng shàng.
examples.english: He smeared white paint on the wall.

examples.chinese: 请把黑板上的字抹掉(請把黑板上的字抹掉)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng bǎ hēibǎn shàng de zì mǒdiào.
examples.english: Please wipe off the words on the blackboard.

examples.chinese: 她用手轻轻抹去眼泪(她用手輕輕抹去眼淚)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng shǒu qīngqīng mǒqù yǎnlèi.
examples.english: She gently wiped away her tears with her hand.
